title: Lead I - Software Engineering-DevOps Engineer
description:
**Role Description**
**DevOps Engineer – Role Summary**
 The DevOps Engineer will be responsible for managing the complete DevOps lifecycle with a focus on developing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines, onboarding infrastructure for the ORS platform, and automating processes to reduce manual effort and improve system reliability. The role demands a strong understanding of Linux systems, scripting, observability tools, and modern DevOps methodologies. The engineer will work closely with global teams and stakeholders to foster a collaborative and inclusive environment.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design, build, and maintain CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins and Git.
* Onboard and manage infrastructure components for ORS platform.
* Develop and maintain DevOps tooling and automation to optimize operations.
* Drive environment stability and implement infrastructure hygiene standards.
* Implement observability and telemetry using tools like Splunk, Prometheus, Loki, and Grafana.
* Liaise with global teams, stakeholders, and RPE to ensure smooth delivery and support.
* Manage hybrid infrastructure (cloud \\& on\\-prem) for large\\-scale platforms.
* Support Kubernetes, Docker\\-based deployments and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).


**✅ Required Skills**
* Strong in Linux, OS fundamentals, and networking.
* Advanced scripting skills in Python and Bash.
* Proficient with DevOps tools – Jenkins, Git, Autosys, Terraform, etc.
* Experience in observability tools – Splunk, Prometheus, Loki, Grafana.
* Familiar with containerization and orchestration tools: Docker, Kubernetes.
* Experience in managing cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP).
* Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
* Proactive learning attitude toward new systems and technologies.


**Preferred / Nice To Have**
* Exposure to data domains, ETL workflows, or related data engineering concepts.


 Role \\- Devops engineer Leverage expertise throughout the DevOps lifecycle to build and maintain CI/CD solutions. Onboard and maintain infrastructure components for the ORS platform. Develop/maintain DevOps tooling and automation solutions to reduce toil and optimize processes. Drive the environment stability initiatives, lay the foundations for adoption of automation, meeting Firm's infrastructure and software hygiene requirements. Implement observability/telemetry solutions by leveraging both cloud\\-native and open\\-source tools for complex systems. Liaise with stakeholders, global team members and RPE, fostering an inclusive and positive working environment in the team. Required: Strong understanding of Linux systems, OS fundamentals \\& networking. Strong scripting experience in Python and Bash. Experience with modern DevOps tools and practices including Git, Jenkins, CI/CD, Autosys, Observability tooling (Splunk, Prometheus, Loki, Grafana, etc.), laC, etc. Understanding of modern distributed systems architecture (Kubernetes, Docker, etc.) Experience in procuring and maintaining both cloud and on\\-prem infras.ucture for large platforms. Experience with any of the public cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP). Good analytical capability, logical problem\\-solving skills and be ability to work in a fast\\-paced environment. Excellent communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skills. Willingness to learn new systems and technologies. Desired: Experience in data domains and ETL workflows.
   

  

**Skills**
 Python,Bash,Devopstools,Cloud platform

title: Lead II - Software Engineering
description:
**Role Description**
**Job Title:**
**JD Edwards Functional Consultant – Sales \\& Distribution**
**Experience Required**
**7–10 years** 
 of hands\\-on JD Edwards EnterpriseOne (E1\\) experience in Sales, Distribution, and Procurement modules, with implementation, configuration, and functional expertise.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 We are seeking a seasoned
 **JD Edwards Functional Consultant (Sales \\& Distribution)** 
 to drive solution design, configuration, and deployment of the JD Edwards EnterpriseOne (E1\\) system in alignment with business processes. The role demands strong domain knowledge in Sales, Distribution, Procurement, and Inventory, and the ability to effectively collaborate with cross\\-functional teams in a global environment.
   

  

 You will be responsible for interpreting business requirements into system configurations, creating functional documentation, supporting system testing, and providing guidance to development and integration teams. Expertise in EDI, interoperability, and SQL is desirable.
   

  

**Role Proficiency**
* Actively engage in the creative design and development of solutions by selecting appropriate technical and functional options.
* Optimize application performance, maintainability, and development using proven best practices.
* Guide and support team members in delivery activities and assist the Project Manager with day\\-to\\-day execution.


**Key Responsibilities**
**Functional Analysis \\& Design:**
* Lead requirement gathering sessions with business stakeholders.
* Analyze and document functional requirements and translate them into system configurations.
* Design end\\-to\\-end functional solutions across Sales, Distribution, Procurement, and Inventory modules.
* Configure JD Edwards E1 (9\\.2\\) to support business processes and workflows.


**Documentation \\& Specifications**
* Create functional design documents, test cases, training guides, and user manuals.
* Write clear and concise functional specifications for technical teams.
* Ensure traceability of requirements through design, development, and testing.


**Configuration \\& Testing**
* Perform system configuration and testing based on business needs.
* Support system integration and user acceptance testing (UAT).
* Validate functional results with business representatives and ensure sign\\-offs.


**Integration \\& Interoperability**
* Map and manage data integrations across modules and with third\\-party systems.
* Good knowledge of E1 tables, interoperability, and data mapping.
* Support and troubleshoot EDI transactions (850, 855, 856, 810, etc.).


**Collaboration \\& Communication**
* Work closely with business users, technical developers, and other functional teams.
* Liaise with manufacturing, finance, and inventory teams to ensure process continuity.
* Lead meetings, present functional designs, and provide training and support to end users.


**Continuous Improvement**
* Identify gaps in functionality or processes and recommend enhancements.
* Assist with root cause analysis of defects and provide solutions.
* Support process optimization initiatives and continuous improvement.


**Expected Outcomes**
* Accurately interpret application features and component designs to develop scalable functional solutions.
* Deliver high\\-quality documentation, configurations, and test cases.
* Reduce number of defects and technical issues through quality\\-first execution.
* Optimize system efficiency, performance, and business value.
* Positively influence customer satisfaction and employee engagement.
* Set and support FAST goals for self and team.


**Key Measures Of Success**
* Adherence to project timelines and engineering standards.
* Minimal defects post\\-delivery.
* Reduced number of rework or non\\-compliance issues.
* Timely delivery of documentation and configurations.
* Improved customer satisfaction scores.
* On\\-time completion of compliance and functional trainings.


**Technical \\& Functional Skills**
**JD Edwards EnterpriseOne (E1\\):** 
  

  

* Deep functional knowledge of:
+ Sales Order Management
+ Procurement
+ Inventory Management
+ Intercompany Transactions

* Knowledge of integration with Manufacturing and Finance modules is a strong plus.
* Experience in E1 table structures, fields, and interoperability frameworks.


**Tool \\& Tech Proficiency**
* JD Edwards E1 9\\.2 (Sales and Distribution Implementation)
* Writing simple to complex SQL queries
* Familiarity with Agile / DevOps methodology
* Experience with EDI transactions (850, 855, 856, 810\\)
* Basic knowledge of Data Mapping and transformation techniques


**Soft Skills \\& Attributes**
* Strong communication skills—both written and verbal.
* Ability to translate technical concepts into business\\-friendly language.
* Analytical mindset with a problem\\-solving approach.
* Team leadership and mentoring capabilities.
* Ability to work under pressure, multitask, and meet deadlines.
* High business etiquette in emails, meetings, and documentation.


**Certifications (Preferred But Not Mandatory)**
* JD Edwards EnterpriseOne Functional Certifications
* Agile or Scrum Certifications (CSM, SAFe, etc.)
* Domain\\-specific certifications in Supply Chain or Procurement (if applicable)


**Work Environment**
* May require flexible work hours across time zones.
* Ability to work remotely or in hybrid teams.
* Interaction with global stakeholders and technical teams.


**Additional Deliverables / Role Scope**
* Support project delivery and system go\\-lives.
* Perform root cause analysis (RCA) on functional defects.

description:

**Key Responsibilities**

* Facilitate communication and collaboration across engineering, compliance, and executive teams.


**Must\\-Have Qualifications**

title: DevOps/ SRE Engineer - Bash/ Python/ Go, Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, Cloud
description:
**Role Description**
**Job Summary:**
 We are seeking an experienced
 **Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)** 
 with advanced DevOps expertise to help build, scale, and maintain our infrastructure and services. You will play a critical role in ensuring high availability, performance, scalability, and security of our production systems, while enabling continuous deployment and rapid delivery of features to our customers.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design, build, and maintain reliable, scalable, and secure cloud\\-based infrastructure (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
* Develop and improve observability using monitoring, ing, logging, and tracing tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, Datadog, etc.).
* Automate repetitive tasks and infrastructure using Infrastructure\\-as\\-Code (Terraform, CloudFormation, Pulumi).
* Create and maintain CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins, ArgoCD, etc.) to support fast and safe delivery.
* Lead incident response, root cause analysis, and postmortems to ensure high uptime and rapid recovery.
* Optimize system performance, reliability, and cost\\-effectiveness through proactive monitoring and tuning.
* Collaborate with software engineering teams to define SLAs/SLOs and improve service reliability.
* Implement and maintain security best practices across environments (e.g., secrets management, IAM, firewalls, etc.).
* Maintain disaster recovery plans, backups, and high\\-availability strategies.


**Qualifications**
**Required:**
* 5\\+ years of experience as an SRE, DevOps Engineer, or similar role.
* Proficiency in scripting and automation (Bash, Python, Go, etc.).
* Strong experience with containerization and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm).
* Solid understanding of Linux systems administration and networking fundamentals.
* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
* Experience with IaC tools like Terraform or CloudFormation.
* Familiarity with GitOps and modern deployment practices.
* Hands\\-on experience with observability tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog).
* Strong troubleshooting and incident response skills.


**Preferred**
* Experience in a high\\-traffic, microservices\\-based architecture.
* Exposure to service meshes (Istio, Linkerd).
* Certifications (AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, CKA, etc.)
* Experience with security automation and compliance (e.g., SOC2, ISO27001\\).


**Soft Skills**
* Strong communication and collaboration abilities.
* Ability to thrive in a fast\\-paced, agile environment.
* Analytical mindset and proactive approach to problem\\-solving.
* A passion for automation, performance, and system design.


**Skills**
 DevOps/ SRE, Bash/ Python/ Go, Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, Cloud

Key Responsibilities: Design, develop, and maintain scalable and secure backend services using Java and Kotlin. Build and deploy containerized applications using Docker and manage infrastructure on AWS. Collaborate closely with front\\-end engineers, DevOps, product managers, and QA teams to deliver full\\-stack features. Write clean, testable, and efficient code following best practices and coding standards. Participate in code reviews, system architecture discussions, and contribute to technical decision\\-making. Use Python for automation scripts, data processing, or supporting tools when needed. Monitor, debug, and optimize application performance in production environments. Contribute to the evolution of engineering processes and best practices. Required Skills \\& Qualifications: 9\\+ years of professional software development experience with a strong backend focus. Expertise in Java, spring batch and some experience in Kotlin, with deep understanding of object\\-oriented and functional programming paradigms. Hands\\-on experience with Docker for containerization and microservices architecture. Strong knowledge of AWS services (e.g., EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, ECS/EKS, etc.). Working knowledge of Python for scripting or auxiliary tools. Solid understanding of RESTful APIs, multithreading, and asynchronous programming. Experience with CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, and performance monitoring tools. Strong problem\\-solving skills, system design experience, and ability to work independently or lead small teams.
   

  

**Skills**
 Java,Spring Batch,Docker,AWS

**Code**
 Outputs Expected:
   

  

* Develop data processing code with guidance ensuring performance and scalability requirements are met.

**Documentation**
* Create/review templates checklists guidelines and standards for design/process/development.
* Create/review deliverable documents including design documents architecture documents infra costing business requirements source\\-target mappings test cases and results.

* Obtain relevant domain and technology certifications.


**Skill Examples**
* Proficiency in SQL Python or other programming languages used for data manipulation.
* Experience with ETL tools such as Apache Airflow Talend Informatica AWS Glue Dataproc and Azure ADF.
* Hands\\-on experience with cloud platforms like AWS Azure or Google Cloud particularly with data\\-related services (e.g. AWS Glue BigQuery).

 Knowledge Examples

**Additional Comments**
 Sr Data Engineer Position Location: OUS with minimum of 6 hrs. overlap with US timings. Must have Skills\\* 1\\. 15 years of experience in design and delivery of Distributed Systems capable of handling petabytes of data in a distributed environment. 2\\. 10 years of experience in the development of Data Lakes with Data Ingestion from disparate data sources, including relational databases, flat files, APIs, and streaming data. 3\\. Experience in providing Design and development of Data Platforms and data ingestion from disparate data sources into the cloud. 4\\. Expertise in core AWS Services including AWS IAM, VPC, EC2, EKS/ECS, S3, RDS, DMS, Lambda, CloudWatch, CloudFormation, CloudTrail, CloudWatch. 5\\. Proficiency in programming languages like Python and PySpark to ensure efficient data processing. preferably Python. 6\\. Architect and implement robust ETL pipelines using AWS Glue, defining data extraction methods, transformation logic, and data loading procedures across different data sources 7\\. 15 years of Experience in using IaC tools like Terraform etc. 8\\. 10 years of experience in development of CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, Jenkins). 9\\. Experience in the development of Event\\-Driven Distributed Systems in the Cloud using Serverless Architecture. 10\\. Ability to work with Infrastructure team for AWS service provisioning for databases, services, network design, IAM roles and AWS cluster. 11\\. 2\\-3 years of experience working with Document DB. 12\\. Ability to design, orchestrate and schedule jobs using Airflow. 13\\. Knowledge of AWS AI Services like AWS Entity Resolution, AWS Comprehend. 14\\. Ability to run custom LLMs using Amazon SageMaker. 15\\. Ability to use Large Language Models (LLMs) for Data Classification and Identification of PII data entities Nice to have Skills: 1\\. 10 years of experience in the development of Data Audit, Compliance and Retention standards for Data Governance, and automation of the governance processes. 2\\. Experience in data modelling with NoSQL Databases like Document DB. 3\\. Experience in using column\\-oriented data file format like Apache Parquet, and Apache Iceberg as the table format for analytical datasets. 4\\. Expertise in development of Retrieval\\-Augmented Generation (RAG) and Agentic Workflows for providing context to LLMs based on proprietary enterprise data. 5\\. Ability to develop re\\-ranking strategies using results from Index and Vector stores for LLMs to improve the quality of the output.

title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)
description:
**Qualifications**
**Role description**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in IT or related field.
* 5\\+ years experience in Site Reliability Engineering, DevOps, or Systems Engineering.
* Strong skills in IT infrastructure: systems, networking, virtualization.
* Hands\\-on experience with Azure cloud services (AZ\\-900 level or higher).
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, ARM templates, PowerShell).
* Familiarity with monitoring tools like Grafana, Application Insights, or similar.
* Knowledge of Azure SQL or similar databases.
* Experience building and securing CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps.
* Containerization and Kubernetes experience, especially securing container workloads.
* Agile/Scrum experience.
* Bonus: Experience with European compliance standards (GDPR, SOC 2, ISO 27001\\).


**Technical Skills**
* Master SRE best practices, Azure infrastructure, IaC, MS SQL, and deployment pipelines.
* Design and enforce secure Azure environments (RBAC, NSGs, Azure Policy).
* Manage identity and access (MFA, conditional access, managed identities).
* Integrate security checks into IaC scripts.
* Detect and fix cloud vulnerabilities using security tools.
* Ensure data protection and encryption (Azure Key Vault).
* Monitor systems and respond to incidents using Azure Monitor, Application Insights, and tools.
* Maintain compliance with security standards (ISO 27001, SOC 2, GDPR).
* Embed security into DevOps pipelines.
* Promote Zero Trust security principles.


**Project Contribution**
* Support critical SRE projects with architecture and security guidance.
* Maintain and improve IaC code quality and security.
* Identify risks and implement mitigation.
* Advise senior engineers and track project progress.


**Collaboration \\& Communication**
* Work with developers, QA, InfoSec, and managers to ensure security and reliability.
* Communicate clearly in meetings and documentation.
* Lead Agile Scrum ceremonies with security focus.


**Growth \\& Innovation**
* Propose new security tools and automation ideas.
* Optimize security and reliability processes.
* Share knowledge and promote security culture.
* Stay updated on Azure security trends and best practices.


**Skills**
 Azure,Terraform,Kubernetes,Sql

title: Developer III - SFDC CPQ BA
description:
**Role Description**
**Job Title: Salesforce CPQ Business Analyst**
**Location: Bangalore/Chennai/Kochi/Trivandrum/Gurgaon/Noida/Hyd/Pune**
**Experience Range**
* Total IT Experience: Minimum 5 years
* Salesforce.com Experience: Minimum 4 years
* Salesforce CPQ Project Experience: Minimum 2\\-3 end\\-to\\-end implementations


**Job Summary**
 We are looking for an experienced
 **Salesforce CPQ Business Analyst** 
 who will lead the requirements gathering and solution design phases of complex Salesforce CPQ implementations. The ideal candidate will have deep functional knowledge of Salesforce CPQ and experience in managing end\\-to\\-end client interactions, particularly in global, multi\\-vendor environments.
   

  

**Must\\-Have Skills** 
  

  

* Salesforce CPQ Expertise:
+ Product Features and Bundles
+ Product Rules, Price Rules
+ Quote Templates
+ Solution Design and Requirement Analysis
+ Hands\\-on CPQ Configuration for prototyping

* Salesforce CPQ Implementations:
+ At least 2–3 full\\-lifecycle Salesforce CPQ projects

* Documentation \\& BA Skills:
+ BRD, SRS, Gap Analysis, Use Cases
+ Solution Design / Technical Design Documentation

* Stakeholder Management:
+ Experience with US/UK clients
+ End\\-to\\-end engagement with business users across geographies

* Communication \\& Leadership:
+ Outstanding verbal and written communication
+ Experience conducting whiteboarding/design brainstorming sessions


**Good\\-to\\-Have Skills** 
  

  

* Salesforce Certifications:
+ Must Have: Salesforce CPQ Specialist
+ Nice to Have: Sales Cloud Consultant, Service Cloud Consultant, App Builder, or Advanced Admin

* Salesforce Configuration / Coding (for POCs):
+ Basic understanding of Apex and Visualforce
+ Ability to create prototype configurations

* Experience in Multi\\-Vendor/Multi\\-Company Environments


**Certifications**
* Mandatory: Salesforce CPQ Specialist
* Preferred: Service Cloud Consultant, Sales Cloud Consultant, Platform App Builder, Advanced Admin


**Role Responsibilities**
* Engage with clients to gather and analyze business requirements
* Create detailed documentation including BRDs, SRS, and solution designs
* Lead CPQ solution design and prototype configurations
* Facilitate design workshops and user walkthroughs
* Coordinate with offshore configuration, development, and testing teams
* Serve as liaison between IT and business stakeholders
* Ensure timely issue resolution and requirements clarification
